issue.title: Enable SVG support to allow Starter Sites to use SVG files for images

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the requested feature in a clear and concise way. -->
We can enable SVG support during import to allow Starter Sites to also use SVG files.
This will be disabled after the import and will only be used during the import cycle.

### Alternatives:
<!-- If we don't implement this feature, what would be the best alternatives to achieve the same functionality? -->
We will not be able to use SVG in Starter Sites as it will not be imported.

issue.title: get_plugin_key_by_slug method is unreliable

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
The `get_plugin_key_by_slug` method is unreliable, resulting in some plugins not getting deleted when doing an import cleanup
https://github.com/Codeinwp/templates-patterns-collection/blob/16c85b9713589d0fb2b850aac627bd02e96aab3f/includes/Importers/Cleanup/Manager.php#L82-L89

Adding some `error_log` statements, as you can see in the logs below, it seems it would be more reliable to check if `$slug`  coincides with the part of the `$key` before the `/`.

I am unsure if something changed in a core update or if something else happened. 

@preda-bogdan, what do you think about this? 


Just to be clear, right now we return the `KEY` if `NAME === SLUG`. Which they never seem to do.
```

issue.title: Speaker deck block not responsive

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the bug in a clear and concise way. -->
The speaker deck block doesn't resize if the browser window size is reduced or if the container is set to a smaller value. This results in the images and the entire block being cropped. The issue doesn't occur with default themes like Twenty Twenty One.

### How to reproduce:
<!-- Describe the steps needed to reproduce this. -->
1. Add the Speaker deck block on a page (you can use [this link](https://speakerdeck.com/itsdvdart/international-incidents-storyboard-david-nakamura) for the embedded content)
2. Resize the browser window or change the container size

### Expected behaviour:
The block is resized and the images are not cropped.

### Current behaviour:
The block and the images are cropped.

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
[Screenshots from the user](https://imgur.com/a/Q772LXz) showing the behaviour when the window size is reduced and on mobile devices.

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.0.2
* Theme version: 3.4.3

comment.body:
:tada: This issue has been resolved in version 3.4.4 :tada:

The release is available on [GitHub release](https://github.com/Codeinwp/neve/releases/tag/v3.4.4)

issue.title: Add another check for component id
issue.body:
### Summary
I cannot replicate the main issue. By the looks of it, the client either has a child theme and overwrites files from the theme or did some modifications inside the theme files.
I've added a supplementary check for it as it does no harm but the problem shouldn't appear.

### Will affect the visual aspect of the product
NO


### Test instructions

issue.title: Adding Landing pages to the Template Library
issue.body:
As discussed [in Slack](https://vertistudio.slack.com/archives/C02JC68P404/p1664191646111599?thread_ts=1663579666.320889&cid=C02JC68P404), we are going to add landing pages to the template library of the plugin.

Initially, we are going to introduce a generic `Landing page` category where we will include templates from different niches/subcategories. 

Below is a screenshot from the [Figma file](https://www.figma.com/file/r1pLMeeq4nhynBlCKY6mOQ/Coming-Soon-pages?node-id=509%3A1126) where I have been working on some mockups for these templates.

### Templates
Currently the collection will include:

- A personal / bio landing page
- A simple portfolio
- A Linktree-type page
- A wedding announcement page
- A service landing page
- An Event landing page

- One more Coming Soon page
- One more Maintenance page

I will be building the landing pages in the demo site, You should be able to find them [in this page.](https://demosites.io/otter/landing-pages/)

![landing pages](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4193672/192504661-cbb0947c-54dd-4ef5-a836-67696d7416a2.png)

## Points of interest

### Monitoring user preferences through API
As Marius mentioned in Slack, 

> would be super great if we can send the page type selected, both the name and the category on the api when they subscribe with email. in this way we can monitor which category/page they like more.

### Changes in the Wizard

We need to update the Wizard flow, and include a Landing Page option.

### Review for potential changes in the Plugin Settings

We also need to review the current settings and see if we need to make any changes there. Some things we need to do are:

- [x] Include the new templates in the library (design tab)
- [x] Add the Landing page category in the dropdown (design tab)
- [x] Review main settings page and see if we need to make any meaningful changes here, in case the user has selected a Landing page. 

### Next Steps

From my side, I will start building the templates, and -in parallel- work on the Wizard tweaks in order for @arinaturcu to be able to work on it while I complete the design of all templates.

Keeping you in the loop @selul @HardeepAsrani @arinaturcu @mghenciu 

Please let me know your input, suggestions or questions.

Bug Fix

  • BlockPopover: Ensure that padding and margin visualizers display in correct position even when scrolling past block. (#44998)

New features

10.2.0 (2022-10-05)

10.1.0 (2022-09-21)

10.0.0 (2022-09-13)

Breaking change

  • FontSizePicker: Deprecate bottom margin style. Add a __nextHasNoMarginBottom prop to start opting into the margin-free styles that will become the default in a future version, currently scheduled to be WordPress 6.4 (#43870).

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

21.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Ensure that fluid font size presets appear correctly in the UI controls (#44791).
  • ToggleGroupControl: Remove unsupported disabled prop from types, and correctly mark label prop as required (#45114).
  • Navigator: prevent partially hiding focus ring styles, by removing unnecessary overflow rules on NavigatorScreen (#44973).
  • Navigator: restore focus only once per location (#44972).

Documentation

  • VisuallyHidden: Add some notes on best practices around stacking contexts when using this component (#44867).

Internal

  • Modal: Convert to TypeScript (#42949).
  • Sandbox: Use toString to create observe and resize script string (#42872).
  • Navigator: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and to user-event (#44970).
  • Navigator: Refactor Storybook code to TypeScript and controls (#44979).
  • withFilters: Refactor away from _.without() (#44980).
  • withFocusReturn: Refactor tests to @testing-library/react (#45012).
  • ToolsPanel: updated to satisfy react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45028)
  • Tooltip: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45043)

21.2.0 (2022-10-05)

Enhancements

  • FontSizePicker: Updated to take up full width of its parent and have a 40px Reset button when size is __unstable-large ((44559)[https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/44559]).
  • BorderBoxControl: Omit unit select when width values are mixed (#44592)
  • BorderControl: Add ability to disable unit selection (#44592)

Bug Fix

  • Popover: fix limitShift logic by adding iframe offset correctly (#42950).
  • Popover: refine position-to-placement conversion logic, add tests (#44377).
  • ToggleGroupControl: adjust icon color when inactive, from gray-700 to gray-900 (#44575).
  • TokenInput: improve logic around the aria-activedescendant attribute, which was causing unintended focus behavior for some screen readers (#44526).
  • NavigatorScreen: fix focus issue where back button received focus unexpectedly (#44239)
  • FontSizePicker: Fix header order in RTL languages (#44590).

Enhancements

  • SuggestionList: use requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout when scrolling selected item into view. This change improves the responsiveness of the ComboboxControl and FormTokenField components when rapidly hovering over the suggestion items in the list (#44573).

Internal

  • Mobile updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#44207).
  • Popover: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and modern RTL assertions (#44373).
  • SearchControl: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule in native files(#44381)

... (truncated)

issue.title: Bump @wordpress/components from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

21.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Ensure that fluid font size presets appear correctly in the UI controls (#44791).
  • ToggleGroupControl: Remove unsupported disabled prop from types, and correctly mark label prop as required (#45114).
  • Navigator: prevent partially hiding focus ring styles, by removing unnecessary overflow rules on NavigatorScreen (#44973).
  • Navigator: restore focus only once per location (#44972).

Documentation

  • VisuallyHidden: Add some notes on best practices around stacking contexts when using this component (#44867).

Internal

  • Modal: Convert to TypeScript (#42949).
  • Sandbox: Use toString to create observe and resize script string (#42872).
  • Navigator: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and to user-event (#44970).
  • Navigator: Refactor Storybook code to TypeScript and controls (#44979).
  • withFilters: Refactor away from _.without() (#44980).
  • withFocusReturn: Refactor tests to @testing-library/react (#45012).
  • ToolsPanel: updated to satisfy react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45028)
  • Tooltip: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45043)

21.2.0 (2022-10-05)

Enhancements

  • FontSizePicker: Updated to take up full width of its parent and have a 40px Reset button when size is __unstable-large ((44559)[https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/44559]).
  • BorderBoxControl: Omit unit select when width values are mixed (#44592)
  • BorderControl: Add ability to disable unit selection (#44592)

Bug Fix

  • Popover: fix limitShift logic by adding iframe offset correctly (#42950).
  • Popover: refine position-to-placement conversion logic, add tests (#44377).
  • ToggleGroupControl: adjust icon color when inactive, from gray-700 to gray-900 (#44575).
  • TokenInput: improve logic around the aria-activedescendant attribute, which was causing unintended focus behavior for some screen readers (#44526).
  • NavigatorScreen: fix focus issue where back button received focus unexpectedly (#44239)
  • FontSizePicker: Fix header order in RTL languages (#44590).

Enhancements

  • SuggestionList: use requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout when scrolling selected item into view. This change improves the responsiveness of the ComboboxControl and FormTokenField components when rapidly hovering over the suggestion items in the list (#44573).

Internal

  • Mobile updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#44207).
  • Popover: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and modern RTL assertions (#44373).
  • SearchControl: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule in native files(#44381)

... (truncated)

Commits

issue.title: get_plugin_key_by_slug method is unreliable

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
The `get_plugin_key_by_slug` method is unreliable, resulting in some plugins not getting deleted when doing an import cleanup
https://github.com/Codeinwp/templates-patterns-collection/blob/16c85b9713589d0fb2b850aac627bd02e96aab3f/includes/Importers/Cleanup/Manager.php#L82-L89

Adding some `error_log` statements, as you can see in the logs below, it seems it would be more reliable to check if `$slug`  coincides with the part of the `$key` before the `/`.

I am unsure if something changed in a core update or if something else happened. 

@preda-bogdan, what do you think about this? 


Just to be clear, right now we return the `KEY` if `NAME === SLUG`. Which they never seem to do.
```

issue.title: Speaker deck block not responsive

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the bug in a clear and concise way. -->
The speaker deck block doesn't resize if the browser window size is reduced or if the container is set to a smaller value. This results in the images and the entire block being cropped. The issue doesn't occur with default themes like Twenty Twenty One.

### How to reproduce:
<!-- Describe the steps needed to reproduce this. -->
1. Add the Speaker deck block on a page (you can use [this link](https://speakerdeck.com/itsdvdart/international-incidents-storyboard-david-nakamura) for the embedded content)
2. Resize the browser window or change the container size

### Expected behaviour:
The block is resized and the images are not cropped.

### Current behaviour:
The block and the images are cropped.

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
[Screenshots from the user](https://imgur.com/a/Q772LXz) showing the behaviour when the window size is reduced and on mobile devices.

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.0.2
* Theme version: 3.4.3

issue.title: Adding Landing pages to the Template Library
issue.body:
As discussed [in Slack](https://vertistudio.slack.com/archives/C02JC68P404/p1664191646111599?thread_ts=1663579666.320889&cid=C02JC68P404), we are going to add landing pages to the template library of the plugin.

Initially, we are going to introduce a generic `Landing page` category where we will include templates from different niches/subcategories. 

Below is a screenshot from the [Figma file](https://www.figma.com/file/r1pLMeeq4nhynBlCKY6mOQ/Coming-Soon-pages?node-id=509%3A1126) where I have been working on some mockups for these templates.

### Templates
Currently the collection will include:

- A personal / bio landing page
- A simple portfolio
- A Linktree-type page
- A wedding announcement page
- A service landing page
- An Event landing page

- One more Coming Soon page
- One more Maintenance page

I will be building the landing pages in the demo site, You should be able to find them [in this page.](https://demosites.io/otter/landing-pages/)

![landing pages](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4193672/192504661-cbb0947c-54dd-4ef5-a836-67696d7416a2.png)

## Points of interest

### Monitoring user preferences through API
As Marius mentioned in Slack, 

> would be super great if we can send the page type selected, both the name and the category on the api when they subscribe with email. in this way we can monitor which category/page they like more.

### Changes in the Wizard

We need to update the Wizard flow, and include a Landing Page option.

### Review for potential changes in the Plugin Settings

We also need to review the current settings and see if we need to make any changes there. Some things we need to do are:

- [x] Include the new templates in the library (design tab)
- [x] Add the Landing page category in the dropdown (design tab)
- [x] Review main settings page and see if we need to make any meaningful changes here, in case the user has selected a Landing page. 

### Next Steps

From my side, I will start building the templates, and -in parallel- work on the Wizard tweaks in order for @arinaturcu to be able to work on it while I complete the design of all templates.

Keeping you in the loop @selul @HardeepAsrani @arinaturcu @mghenciu 

Please let me know your input, suggestions or questions.

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

21.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Ensure that fluid font size presets appear correctly in the UI controls (#44791).
  • ToggleGroupControl: Remove unsupported disabled prop from types, and correctly mark label prop as required (#45114).
  • Navigator: prevent partially hiding focus ring styles, by removing unnecessary overflow rules on NavigatorScreen (#44973).
  • Navigator: restore focus only once per location (#44972).

Documentation

  • VisuallyHidden: Add some notes on best practices around stacking contexts when using this component (#44867).

Internal

  • Modal: Convert to TypeScript (#42949).
  • Sandbox: Use toString to create observe and resize script string (#42872).
  • Navigator: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and to user-event (#44970).
  • Navigator: Refactor Storybook code to TypeScript and controls (#44979).
  • withFilters: Refactor away from _.without() (#44980).
  • withFocusReturn: Refactor tests to @testing-library/react (#45012).
  • ToolsPanel: updated to satisfy react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45028)
  • Tooltip: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45043)

21.2.0 (2022-10-05)

Enhancements

  • FontSizePicker: Updated to take up full width of its parent and have a 40px Reset button when size is __unstable-large ((44559)[https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/44559]).
  • BorderBoxControl: Omit unit select when width values are mixed (#44592)
  • BorderControl: Add ability to disable unit selection (#44592)

Bug Fix

  • Popover: fix limitShift logic by adding iframe offset correctly (#42950).
  • Popover: refine position-to-placement conversion logic, add tests (#44377).
  • ToggleGroupControl: adjust icon color when inactive, from gray-700 to gray-900 (#44575).
  • TokenInput: improve logic around the aria-activedescendant attribute, which was causing unintended focus behavior for some screen readers (#44526).
  • NavigatorScreen: fix focus issue where back button received focus unexpectedly (#44239)
  • FontSizePicker: Fix header order in RTL languages (#44590).

Enhancements

  • SuggestionList: use requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout when scrolling selected item into view. This change improves the responsiveness of the ComboboxControl and FormTokenField components when rapidly hovering over the suggestion items in the list (#44573).

Internal

  • Mobile updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#44207).
  • Popover: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and modern RTL assertions (#44373).
  • SearchControl: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule in native files(#44381)

issue.title: Bump @wordpress/components from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

21.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Ensure that fluid font size presets appear correctly in the UI controls (#44791).
  • ToggleGroupControl: Remove unsupported disabled prop from types, and correctly mark label prop as required (#45114).
  • Navigator: prevent partially hiding focus ring styles, by removing unnecessary overflow rules on NavigatorScreen (#44973).
  • Navigator: restore focus only once per location (#44972).

Documentation

  • VisuallyHidden: Add some notes on best practices around stacking contexts when using this component (#44867).

Internal

  • Modal: Convert to TypeScript (#42949).
  • Sandbox: Use toString to create observe and resize script string (#42872).
  • Navigator: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and to user-event (#44970).
  • Navigator: Refactor Storybook code to TypeScript and controls (#44979).
  • withFilters: Refactor away from _.without() (#44980).
  • withFocusReturn: Refactor tests to @testing-library/react (#45012).
  • ToolsPanel: updated to satisfy react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45028)
  • Tooltip: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45043)

21.2.0 (2022-10-05)

Enhancements

  • FontSizePicker: Updated to take up full width of its parent and have a 40px Reset button when size is __unstable-large ((44559)[https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/44559]).
  • BorderBoxControl: Omit unit select when width values are mixed (#44592)
  • BorderControl: Add ability to disable unit selection (#44592)

Bug Fix

  • Popover: fix limitShift logic by adding iframe offset correctly (#42950).
  • Popover: refine position-to-placement conversion logic, add tests (#44377).
  • ToggleGroupControl: adjust icon color when inactive, from gray-700 to gray-900 (#44575).
  • TokenInput: improve logic around the aria-activedescendant attribute, which was causing unintended focus behavior for some screen readers (#44526).
  • NavigatorScreen: fix focus issue where back button received focus unexpectedly (#44239)
  • FontSizePicker: Fix header order in RTL languages (#44590).

Enhancements

  • SuggestionList: use requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout when scrolling selected item into view. This change improves the responsiveness of the ComboboxControl and FormTokenField components when rapidly hovering over the suggestion items in the list (#44573).

Internal

  • Mobile updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#44207).
  • Popover: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and modern RTL assertions (#44373).
  • SearchControl: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule in native files(#44381)

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the requested feature in a clear and concise way. -->
We can enable SVG support during import to allow Starter Sites to also use SVG files.
This will be disabled after the import and will only be used during the import cycle.

### Alternatives:
<!-- If we don't implement this feature, what would be the best alternatives to achieve the same functionality? -->
We will not be able to use SVG in Starter Sites as it will not be imported.

issue.title: get_plugin_key_by_slug method is unreliable

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
The `get_plugin_key_by_slug` method is unreliable, resulting in some plugins not getting deleted when doing an import cleanup
https://github.com/Codeinwp/templates-patterns-collection/blob/16c85b9713589d0fb2b850aac627bd02e96aab3f/includes/Importers/Cleanup/Manager.php#L82-L89

Adding some `error_log` statements, as you can see in the logs below, it seems it would be more reliable to check if `$slug`  coincides with the part of the `$key` before the `/`.

I am unsure if something changed in a core update or if something else happened. 

@preda-bogdan, what do you think about this? 


Just to be clear, right now we return the `KEY` if `NAME === SLUG`. Which they never seem to do.

issue.title: Speaker deck block not responsive

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the bug in a clear and concise way. -->
The speaker deck block doesn't resize if the browser window size is reduced or if the container is set to a smaller value. This results in the images and the entire block being cropped. The issue doesn't occur with default themes like Twenty Twenty One.

### How to reproduce:
<!-- Describe the steps needed to reproduce this. -->
1. Add the Speaker deck block on a page (you can use [this link](https://speakerdeck.com/itsdvdart/international-incidents-storyboard-david-nakamura) for the embedded content)
2. Resize the browser window or change the container size

### Expected behaviour:
The block is resized and the images are not cropped.

### Current behaviour:
The block and the images are cropped.

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
[Screenshots from the user](https://imgur.com/a/Q772LXz) showing the behaviour when the window size is reduced and on mobile devices.

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.0.2
* Theme version: 3.4.3

issue.title: Adding Landing pages to the Template Library
issue.body:
As discussed [in Slack](https://vertistudio.slack.com/archives/C02JC68P404/p1664191646111599?thread_ts=1663579666.320889&cid=C02JC68P404), we are going to add landing pages to the template library of the plugin.

Initially, we are going to introduce a generic `Landing page` category where we will include templates from different niches/subcategories. 

Below is a screenshot from the [Figma file](https://www.figma.com/file/r1pLMeeq4nhynBlCKY6mOQ/Coming-Soon-pages?node-id=509%3A1126) where I have been working on some mockups for these templates.

### Templates
Currently the collection will include:

- A personal / bio landing page
- A simple portfolio
- A Linktree-type page
- A wedding announcement page
- A service landing page
- An Event landing page

- One more Coming Soon page
- One more Maintenance page

I will be building the landing pages in the demo site, You should be able to find them [in this page.](https://demosites.io/otter/landing-pages/)

![landing pages](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4193672/192504661-cbb0947c-54dd-4ef5-a836-67696d7416a2.png)

## Points of interest

### Monitoring user preferences through API
As Marius mentioned in Slack, 

> would be super great if we can send the page type selected, both the name and the category on the api when they subscribe with email. in this way we can monitor which category/page they like more.

### Changes in the Wizard

We need to update the Wizard flow, and include a Landing Page option.

### Review for potential changes in the Plugin Settings

We also need to review the current settings and see if we need to make any changes there. Some things we need to do are:

- [x] Include the new templates in the library (design tab)
- [x] Add the Landing page category in the dropdown (design tab)
- [x] Review main settings page and see if we need to make any meaningful changes here, in case the user has selected a Landing page. 

### Next Steps

From my side, I will start building the templates, and -in parallel- work on the Wizard tweaks in order for @arinaturcu to be able to work on it while I complete the design of all templates.

Keeping you in the loop @selul @HardeepAsrani @arinaturcu @mghenciu 

Please let me know your input, suggestions or questions.

Sourced from @​wordpress/block-editor's changelog.

10.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Update fluid utils so that only string, floats and integers are treated as valid font sizes for the purposes of fluid typography (#44847)
  • getTypographyClassesAndStyles(): Ensure that font sizes are transformed into fluid values if fluid typography is activated (#44852)
  • BlockPopover: Ensure that padding and margin visualizers display in correct position even when scrolling past block. (#44998)

New features

  • You can now drop files/blocks/HTML on unmodified default blocks to transform them into corresponding blocks (#44647).

10.2.0 (2022-10-05)

10.1.0 (2022-09-21)

10.0.0 (2022-09-13)

Breaking change

  • FontSizePicker: Deprecate bottom margin style. Add a __nextHasNoMarginBottom prop to start opting into the margin-free styles that will become the default in a future version, currently scheduled to be WordPress 6.4 (#43870).

5.42.0 (2022-10-31)

Bug Fixes

  • ast-spec: add TSQualifiedName to TypeNode union (#5906) (5c316c1)
  • eslint-plugin: [no-extra-parens] handle type assertion in extends clause (#5901) (8ed7219)
  • typescript-estree: don't allow single-run unless we're in type-aware linting mode (#5893) (891b087)

Features

  • eslint-plugin: [member-ordering] add natural sort order (#5662) (1eaae09)
  • eslint-plugin: [no-invalid-void-type] better report message for void used as a constituent inside a function return type (#5274) (d806bda)
  • typescript-estree: clarify docs and error for program project without matching TSConfig (#5762) (67744db)
  • utils: add RuleTester API for top-level dependency constraints (#5896) (0520d53)

v5.41.0

5.41.0 (2022-10-24)

Bug Fixes

  • eslint-plugin: [no-base-to-string] ignore Error, URL, and URLSearchParams by default (#5839) (96e1c6c)

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

21.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Ensure that fluid font size presets appear correctly in the UI controls (#44791).
  • ToggleGroupControl: Remove unsupported disabled prop from types, and correctly mark label prop as required (#45114).
  • Navigator: prevent partially hiding focus ring styles, by removing unnecessary overflow rules on NavigatorScreen (#44973).
  • Navigator: restore focus only once per location (#44972).

Documentation

  • VisuallyHidden: Add some notes on best practices around stacking contexts when using this component (#44867).

Internal

  • Modal: Convert to TypeScript (#42949).
  • Sandbox: Use toString to create observe and resize script string (#42872).
  • Navigator: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and to user-event (#44970).
  • Navigator: Refactor Storybook code to TypeScript and controls (#44979).
  • withFilters: Refactor away from _.without() (#44980).
  • withFocusReturn: Refactor tests to @testing-library/react (#45012).
  • ToolsPanel: updated to satisfy react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45028)
  • Tooltip: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45043)

21.2.0 (2022-10-05)

Enhancements

  • FontSizePicker: Updated to take up full width of its parent and have a 40px Reset button when size is __unstable-large ((44559)[https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/44559]).
  • BorderBoxControl: Omit unit select when width values are mixed (#44592)
  • BorderControl: Add ability to disable unit selection (#44592)

Bug Fix

  • Popover: fix limitShift logic by adding iframe offset correctly (#42950).
  • Popover: refine position-to-placement conversion logic, add tests (#44377).
  • ToggleGroupControl: adjust icon color when inactive, from gray-700 to gray-900 (#44575).
  • TokenInput: improve logic around the aria-activedescendant attribute, which was causing unintended focus behavior for some screen readers (#44526).
  • NavigatorScreen: fix focus issue where back button received focus unexpectedly (#44239)
  • FontSizePicker: Fix header order in RTL languages (#44590).

Enhancements

  • SuggestionList: use requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout when scrolling selected item into view. This change improves the responsiveness of the ComboboxControl and FormTokenField components when rapidly hovering over the suggestion items in the list (#44573).

Internal

  • Mobile updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#44207).
  • Popover: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and modern RTL assertions (#44373).
  • SearchControl: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule in native files(#44381)

... (truncated)

issue.title: Bump @wordpress/components from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 20.0.0 to 21.3.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

21.3.0 (2022-10-19)

Bug Fix

  • FontSizePicker: Ensure that fluid font size presets appear correctly in the UI controls (#44791).
  • ToggleGroupControl: Remove unsupported disabled prop from types, and correctly mark label prop as required (#45114).
  • Navigator: prevent partially hiding focus ring styles, by removing unnecessary overflow rules on NavigatorScreen (#44973).
  • Navigator: restore focus only once per location (#44972).

Documentation

  • VisuallyHidden: Add some notes on best practices around stacking contexts when using this component (#44867).

Internal

  • Modal: Convert to TypeScript (#42949).
  • Sandbox: Use toString to create observe and resize script string (#42872).
  • Navigator: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and to user-event (#44970).
  • Navigator: Refactor Storybook code to TypeScript and controls (#44979).
  • withFilters: Refactor away from _.without() (#44980).
  • withFocusReturn: Refactor tests to @testing-library/react (#45012).
  • ToolsPanel: updated to satisfy react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45028)
  • Tooltip: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45043)

21.2.0 (2022-10-05)

Enhancements

  • FontSizePicker: Updated to take up full width of its parent and have a 40px Reset button when size is __unstable-large ((44559)[https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/WordPress/gutenberg/pull/44559]).
  • BorderBoxControl: Omit unit select when width values are mixed (#44592)
  • BorderControl: Add ability to disable unit selection (#44592)

Bug Fix

  • Popover: fix limitShift logic by adding iframe offset correctly (#42950).
  • Popover: refine position-to-placement conversion logic, add tests (#44377).
  • ToggleGroupControl: adjust icon color when inactive, from gray-700 to gray-900 (#44575).
  • TokenInput: improve logic around the aria-activedescendant attribute, which was causing unintended focus behavior for some screen readers (#44526).
  • NavigatorScreen: fix focus issue where back button received focus unexpectedly (#44239)
  • FontSizePicker: Fix header order in RTL languages (#44590).

Enhancements

  • SuggestionList: use requestAnimationFrame instead of setTimeout when scrolling selected item into view. This change improves the responsiveness of the ComboboxControl and FormTokenField components when rapidly hovering over the suggestion items in the list (#44573).

Internal

  • Mobile updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#44207).
  • Popover: refactor unit tests to TypeScript and modern RTL assertions (#44373).
  • SearchControl: updated to ignore react/exhaustive-deps eslint rule in native files(#44381)
